title: SSL Not Supported Error 29
content:
Getting the above error message when I visit this site: https://publichealth.lacounty.gov/

The site has important Covid-19 information and I have not been able to find a way to connect to it. Cleared cache and disabled all ssl, privacy, blocker settings I could think of, but nothing's worked.

I'm on Win10 using FF 86.0.1. Someone else using Safari on a Mac was able to connect to the site no problem.

Attached is a screenshot of the message I get when trying to connect to the url. Thanks.

title: Firefox bookmarks folders changed location and are schambled
content:
Hi there,

I had about 3k bookmarks well organized in a folder tree (like a folder, then a sub-folder, and sub-sub folder, and so on), located under the "Bookmark Menu" folder. I just realized that many of the folders moved in "Other bookmark". There is no folder anymore, and lots of the bookmarks are at the root of "Other bookmarks". In simple words: the folder structure was destroyed and scrambled.

I checked my backups. The last one being February this year (I changed computer), is also scrambled, but a bit less. So it seems that this was happening little by little, day after day.

I am using Sync.

So anyone has the same bug? Is there a fix?

Thanks!

title: Automatically logging in against my will
content:
I just switched to Firefox for the privacy benefits, but I'm seeing some unexpected security-related behavior that has me slightly concerned. Within Firefox (it could be the first time since powering up my machine), I am automatically logged in to some sites when I first visit them. I don't know why this is happening. Nothing is saved in Lockwise, and all options under "Logins and Passwords" are unchecked (including save and fill passwords). I don't have any syncing. I experience the same behavior if I boot in safe mode. I have LastPass, but this behavior happens even if I'm not logged in to that.

The strangest thing is... I am also automatically logged in to my email website even though it has multi-factor authentication enabled. The auto-login doesn't send any notifications to my authentication device.

Is there some magical setting that I am somehow missing? Thanks so much for any insight!
creator: mushiness

title: update Firefox 64bit using msi
content:
Firefox autoupdate and Firefox sync is disabled in computer. We are using Altiris patch management to update Firefox version. The source is msi file. Computer might has Firefox in difference install locations.

Computer has Firefox 85.0.2 64bit installed to C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox However, Altiris patch management install Firefox 86.0 64bit to C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox

Now computer have 2 versions of Firefox 64bit.

parameter INSTALLDIR=path is not possible because computer might has Firefox in difference install locations.

Is it possible to update using msi replace current install directory instead of new install directory ?

title: Wanted: Search results in urlbar drop-down, but only with keywords
content:
Hi. I have a (supposedly) rather specific question (or request if you will) concerning the urlbar, search results, and any about:config settings, custom css, add-on or whatever else may get me there. (maybe skip to last paragraph)

I've configured my FF, so that anything I enter in the urlbar opens a new tab, I've also set the urlbar drop-down results to include everything they can (to my knowledge), bookmarks, tabs, history, search results. That's how I like it to be, basically. What I don't like so much is that when I enter something that *I* know is not going to be a web search on my part, I don't want the urlbar to automatically add corresponding search results to the top of the drop-down list. Not so much because they're actually there, but because most times it takes about 3-5 seconds for them to appear in the list, so (from unwanted experience) I now wait until the search results appear and the list is "finished" before I click on anything in it (lest I may click the wrong entry, which messes things up, the history, potentially my tabs (depending on what I may accidentally click), and tiny bits of my time and nerves.)

Results from bookmarks, history and tabs are almost instantaneous, so they shouldn't be the problem (as long as digging through the history doesn't stall web searches in some way).

I don't want to put the separate searchbar back on the toolbar. The keyboard shortcut Ctrl+K is now specifically for initiating a search with the default search engine, which makes me think there should be a more apparent reason for the distinction between Ctrl+L and Ctrl+K in matters of "entering stuff in the urlbar" and "actually wanting to search from the urlbar". (or megabar or what it's called)

I'm looking for a way to have search results still available through the drop-down list of the urlbar, but only when I actually want to search for something by using search engine shortcuts (including Ctrl+K). Basically, a combination of the separate searchbar (except it's addressed via shortcuts), and the urlbar as it is now (except without automatic web search results). Any ideas? (and thanks for reading my mess in case you did that)
creator: wolfsschnute
